```{r}
# Load necessary libraries
library(nycflights13)
library(dplyr)
library(moments)

# Display the summary and dimensions of flights dataset
summary(flights)
dim(flights)

# Display the names of all the attributes
names(flights)

# Display the carrier and the flight number of the fastest flight
# (Fastest speed = max(distance / air_time))
fastest_flight <- flights %>%
  mutate(speed = distance / air_time) %>%
  filter(!is.na(speed)) %>%
  arrange(desc(speed)) %>%
  select(carrier, flight) %>%
  slice(1)
print(fastest_flight)

# Which airline has the highest average departure delay?
highest_avg_dep_delay <- flights %>%
  group_by(carrier) %>%
  summarise(avg_dep_delay = mean(dep_delay, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
  arrange(desc(avg_dep_delay)) %>%
  slice(1)
print(highest_avg_dep_delay)

# What is the average arrival delay for each airline?
avg_arr_delay <- flights %>%
  group_by(carrier) %>%
  summarise(avg_arr_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE))
print(avg_arr_delay)

# Identify the month during which the maximum no of flights were operated
max_flights_month <- flights %>%
  group_by(month) %>%
  summarise(total_flights = n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(total_flights)) %>%
  slice(1)
print(max_flights_month)

# Calculate the median and interquartile range for arr_delays of flights, grouped by carrier
arr_delay_stats <- flights %>%
  group_by(carrier) %>%
  summarise(
    median_arr_delay = median(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
    IQR_arr_delay = IQR(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE)
  )
print(arr_delay_stats)

# Obtain the summary statistics of air_time
summary(flights$air_time)

# Find the kurtosis of distance. Comment on its type.
kurt_distance <- kurtosis(flights$distance, na.rm = TRUE)
print(paste("Kurtosis of distance:", kurt_distance))

if (kurt_distance > 3) {
  print("The distribution is leptokurtic (more peaked than normal).")
} else if (kurt_distance < 3) {
  print("The distribution is platykurtic (flatter than normal).")
} else {
  print("The distribution is mesokurtic (similar to normal).")
}

# Find the outliers in distance
Q1 <- quantile(flights$distance, 0.25, na.rm = TRUE)
Q3 <- quantile(flights$distance, 0.75, na.rm = TRUE)
IQR_distance <- IQR(flights$distance, na.rm = TRUE)
lower_bound <- Q1 - 1.5 * IQR_distance
upper_bound <- Q3 + 1.5 * IQR_distance
outliers_distance <- flights %>%
  filter(distance < lower_bound | distance > upper_bound) %>%
  select(distance)
print(outliers_distance)

# Find the relation between air time and arrival delay
correlation_air_time_arr_delay <- cor(flights$air_time, flights$arr_delay, use = "complete.obs")
print(paste("Correlation between air time and arrival delay:", correlation_air_time_arr_delay))

# Interpretation of correlation
if (correlation_air_time_arr_delay > 0) {
  print("There is a positive correlation: as air time increases, arrival delay tends to increase.")
} else if (correlation_air_time_arr_delay < 0) {
  print("There is a negative correlation: as air time increases, arrival delay tends to decrease.")
} else {
  print("There is no correlation between air time and arrival delay.")
}

```
